description:
@ Kiwi PyCon 2013 - Saturday, 07 Sep 2013 - Track 1

**Audience level**

Novice

**Abstract**

This talk will cover:

-  What autopilot is, how it's made, and how it works.
-  How we use it at Canonical, and what benefits we've seen from using
   it.
-  How you can use it to test your own applications.

**Slides**

https://speakerdeck.com/nzpug/thomi-richards-using-autopilot-for-functional-ui-testing
summary:
Autopilot is a tool designed for writing high-level functional tests for
GUI applications. It is written by a team of engineers at Canonical, and
is being used to test everything from the Unity desktop shell to desktop
applications, to core phone applications for the Ubuntu Touch project.
title: Using Autopilot for Functional UI Testing
